meanings.def: a type of music with strong rhythms, in which the players often improvise (= make up the music as they are playing), originally created by African American musicians at the beginning of the 20th century
examples: the rising stars of the New York jazz scene
How's it going? You know—love, life and all that jazz.
How's it going? You know—love, life and all that jazz.

related: and all that (jazz, rubbish, stuff, etc.)
